document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

2B811116E75F40039750250A3A34DBCC.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading,
writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career-readiness level.

A2EB8C038DC2425CB459AC0EBF32C1F8.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking,
and listening at the college and career-readiness level.

8F4E915BF5384F2FA6AB3E5E3D13C13E.description: Analyze the meaning of words with similar denotations.

CE386385BB4E4154A77F8F79062E47AD.description:
Distinguish among the different connotations (associations) and denotations (definitions)
of words (e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent, resolute).

B162F6026A814A2A8F00653E497DBC64.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., euphemism) in context and analyze their role in the text.

859B79CB6A1A450F8B8B492E98051401.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

8D15B32E1964469A8352D364E2C8F8CF.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

3B7DB1B6F12147158E0EE32B23624230.description:
Consult both digital and print reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauri) to
find a word’s pronunciation, parts of speech, spelling, origin, and meaning.

3A7FDF5AEA4047D083C07C1D55732916.description:
Analyze word changes to indicate different meanings or parts of speech (e.g.,
analyze/analysis/analytical, advocate/advocacy).

A54CAE9119CB428B8E102ED70F9D5CEE.description: Use context clues to help determine the meaning of a word or phrase.

814FB1DB4A924B65BB2E959739AAB75B.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on
appropriately complex reading and content, choosing flexibly from a variety of strategies.

F8CD83E007B047D68AA3BD21091D6EF2.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts,
and consulting reference materials.

439FFE7CE51240888DB90AEE8708B536.description: Use verbs in the active and passive voice and in the conditional and subjunctive mood to achieve particular effects.

BA3B5A2E163D425D8F12CE17C5589267.description:
Apply knowledge of language to understand how it functions in different contexts, to make effective choices
for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

7BE46815B5074ED09A518B0697313CF9.description: Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style, and comprehension.

18CB12D30C99429FA9E615A279BCB949.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

A8908B381247473B8CF979EBB2518EDF.description: Use advanced punctuation (e.g., comma, ellipsis, dash) correctly.

8B6FD0461B5B47CEAFE51FCED415F168.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

55C4D4B314E344029C47B5AF2840B0DE.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

D70D0772EF5947EF974F7D0A8457E893.description: Use various types of clauses: independent/dependent, noun, relative, adverbial.

545FD0B45B8642389AE28C1449400C64.description: Use various types of phrases: noun, verb, infinitive, adjectival, adverbial, participial, and prepositional.

514F00AF404046C2B8DBAA8499ABD1B5.description:
Use parallel structure with conjunctions (e.g., “and” and “or”) to show that two or more
ideas have the same level of importance (e.g., He likes to jog, swim, and hike.).

23F80CAA848D4737BC58F83B1B559133.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

0A93BAAB0B734ABCA56F46D3277A013A.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

BCE302354EAA4305AF48718FFB394596.description: Analyze and arrange/write essays, stories, autobiographies, and/or research.

9A30CAF1D62847AA8F8099BE5EFC7490.description: Analyze and respond to letters, reflections, and revision (s).

3697A9A046E94C0091D172D28920F444.description:
Write routinely for short and extended periods of time to develop various types of paragraphs, formal and informal letters, and essays (including, but not limited to, narrative, persuasive, and descriptive writing and knowledge of their qualities) on a variety of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences (e.g.,
integrating technology or digital/print resources).

4DB8A1B17C0A4A6BA6477FC4395C4AAF.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

B5EB3C27E8914F179B6B0E777AE72BC3.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

F3FCFBEF6A6B41088CFDD4BFE68A3F3F.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

ADBD753E577848A3AC8939D195F78D4D.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source. Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others avoiding plagiarism.

ABCD851EF70C4B55A0DBB624AB68E897.description: Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources using search terms effectively.

2362C919C330452ABA4BD57E2F7D0883.description: Using multiple sources, participate in or conduct research to gather information that answers questions about a single topic.

4DD17D0902D74411BE7DED505A6B2E88.description: As part of a research project, write a report that answers a thesis question, drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation.

D69C6217B698424E941D2B94BFFBA7A9.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

7C7D4BDA8E5A462AA6911D918574A061.description:
Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing, link to and cite sources, and interact
and collaborate with others.

B04DA233DD7E42EFB07D295FF90B397A.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others and produce and publish writing.

054AA28C2F5F4240A1927E8B3345D122.description: Focus on how well purpose and audience have been addressed, avoiding plagiarism, considering style guides (e.g., MLA and APA student format), and using citations.

6ECB941B3A3045B18D246CC67BEE1BD1.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, drafting, revising, editing (using editing marks),
rewriting, and publishing.

C81F2AB88F294941A50C732090DC6365.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting,
and publishing).

A79223424DED4E3C89A7787AC78E759D.description:
Use literary elements like narrative structure, theme, mood, plot, setting, or moral to
organize and lengthen writing.

651B3749DBBD4E24B20F2C6A8A72C697.description: Use effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

07DD347F4C95450D89CA3960F01E6265.description: Write literary texts that develop real or imagined experiences or events using transitional words and other cohesive devices to better organize writing in 5 or more paragraphs of 6 or more sentences each.

8E35F8C31E4944669752F2D332791CF0.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

B10B91FF646749898FDBB24D0CC39FE9.description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify relationships among ideas and concepts.

9D376A7EA2F64A0B8315915B97BFED17.description: Introduce a topic or thesis statement. Organize ideas, concepts, and information.

6B6564E9898A49D0AA8617B545E0F11E.description: Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information through effective technique, organization, and analysis of content clearly and accurately in 5 or more paragraphs of 6 or more sentences each.

37C826950C834D59A0A09385E394A840.description:
Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the
selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

5F8BF40B71564C2F9067DAAEA2DA70DA.description: Use reliable sources to demonstrate understanding of the topic or text.

F0E2CDBB5F4A406696BC382136DCA4A5.description: Support claim(s) or counterarguments with logical reasoning and relevant evidence.

5826406C598047B2905B66C529BA9985.description: Explain and clarify viewpoints and opinions. Take and defend positions that differ from others.

1A14AC7A654D402EBB5C35F24088B769.description:
Justify opinions or persuade others by providing textual evidence or relevant background knowledge with moderate support on a variety of personal, social, and cultural topics and current events in a composition of
5 or more paragraphs of 6 or more sentences each.

FA47D19B45754665A5E03E8889AE469F.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

6F7DF0CCFFF140BF8FC349519F2CA164.description:
Read and comprehend a variety of literature (e.g., stories, dramas, and poetry) and informational texts (e.g.,
history, social studies, science, and technical texts) of appropriate complexity.

0785A7B467C4475C80BAB2901D4BB9DD.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

309D05CD21024E75BDDDFA528C3526D1.description:
Analyze a case in which 2 or more informational texts provide conflicting information on the
same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

E87A523111C94CC29B2EC8CE4E27065D.description:
Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types
from myths, traditional stories, or religious works. Describe how the material is rendered new.

E14B46F95D2243158618BAFE80D53C30.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

7C875FB340A24201B21020F167393504.description:
Recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced. This includes, but is not limited to, narrative,
persuasive, and descriptive writing and knowledge of their qualities.

4E95D189C8D9429499F20D10722C1D1C.description:
Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific evidence in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound
and the evidence is relevant and sufficient.

B3137986F464447CAD2AF68E31E770D5.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

87CF562CB568432F9A3C6491AFA65B08.description:
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different types of media (e.g., print or digital
texts, videos, multimedia resources) to present a particular topic or idea.

5F0DF63DCAA846478C9EB3C4FD218F9C.description:
Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or
departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors.

116F00E063AE45ACAC19F94C7F51E0D1.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

12CAA6D182994820B5F456B886C14100.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in an informational text and analyze how the
author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

3B23F2EC6ABA41258FB280A9A9C1295E.description: Analyze how differences in the points of view of the characters create an effect on the reader.

097362E3961E4874A3686BE0BCF4D498.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

3919150B91384204AE2482F659183B47.description:
Analyze the structure of a specific paragraph in an informational text in detail, including the role
of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept.

74EA171AF3B04235AF8EF34ABAD9B0A2.description:
Compare and contrast the structure of two or more literary texts and analyze how the differing
structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style.

B3430D0FCF7F4806B62AD985DEE81747.description:
Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections,
chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

05A0679E63544AB681FD25DC9A0DDAC3.description:
Analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or
allusions to other texts.

D7DD5FE508B740F08F7D1EE2F8669016.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in an informational text, including
figurative, connotative, and technical meanings (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

D026D46349E44FC282FF2C721A9765C1.description:
Analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or
allusions to other texts.

62739BB53314400EBAC02F16AF636F10.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a literary text, including
figurative and connotative meanings (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

9FF55E3FA32D4BBA92EC3A5463CA691A.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze
how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

0D8C24A569CC41B093F239D4C37900BE.description:
Analyze the connections and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events. Connect cause
and effect relationships.

633D1A0E4DA64DF38BAF0900DAC890A7.description:
Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama develop the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision. Analyze character traits to deepen
understanding of the text.

06E0812BB7E64FED960C6EE0934AB3E1.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

09AA9E4946F34C22AA9E2A0D76CD2687.description:
Determine a main idea of an informational text and analyze its development over the course of
the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas. Provide a summary of the text.

8A8D156B6AFD40EFA3414B06532BCF16.description:
Determine a theme or main idea of a literary text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to the characters, setting, and plot. Provide a summary of the
text.

3EB76FCCBBC0420F988C1C2C2272F6CC.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

8EA79BDA43FA4DAE85F696FE3AFB9344.description: Make inferences and draw conclusions from texts to support analysis.

7C1F7D9E6060429FA8C78D136490EAFF.description: Identify facts/details that support main idea(s) from the texts.

D6187D2483904ECB9A536A42EBB873E0.description:
Read a variety of grade-level texts and view a variety of multimedia resources (when available) to explain ideas, phenomena, processes, cultural identities, genres, and text relationships, supplying textual evidence to support
analyses and conclusions drawn from the text.

1F271DE5E6AE4E3A94DA2090FF587A3C.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text.

B95B9662D2364114A03229AE791CBA0A.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

BAC40313CDE04A61ADF11B913B9BC2B3.description:
Accurately read on-level prose and poetry orally with appropriate rate and expression on
successive readings.

B759669211A744909BE55EA7D5CCE1BF.description: Read on-level texts with purpose and understanding.

8A5D0E1A2F25456C88CF4583320836E9.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

D33DE344592A4041881FEEFA69BADBC2.description:
Process encoding sounds through letters (s,r), consonant blends (sh, sk), digraphs (ay, ew), or
trigraphs (sch, thr) using conventional spelling patterns to form words.

A362F73B07134793B62B35B8F1209319.description: Apply meaning to single units of sound in existing word parts to encode a given word.

0C72BF0EC031403BB78F29842F0DF2EA.description:
Accurately read multisyllabic words using a combined knowledge of all letter-sound
correspondences and syllabication patterns.

948A885C9B8D44D8823953F587D42D97.description:
Use a combined knowledge of strategies to encode grade-level monosyllabic and multisyllabic
words.

C0AEE38CEC044D509B1AB5999E28FA60.description: Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode and encode words.

FA217A2FFAFA4029A24627F5212E3E4B.description: Refer to previous grades as needed to reinforce these skills.

E6E7DA3D346E439FB4EFEB7361696F70.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

81B22DC8032C49F993EC43A5ABBC51F9.description:
Provide complex reference information of source(s) applying required MLA and APA student
format.

2B3A335F3EFE428580FFEE647A7E5FA1.description:
Cite or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others avoiding plagiarism and following a
standard format for citation (e.g., MLA and APA student format).

A37E70692D914D6CA8098136C3679512.description: Recognize and gather relevant information from multiple reliable print and digital sources.

0BAD48C3DB034E0AB1D454F7A3EDA01B.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

524993656D034AFE93BBC88D9357227E.description: Plan and deliver different types of formal and informal oral presentations and reports that enhance grade- appropriate topics and present evidence and facts that support ideas (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

028E4B0FB28146C39869513AEEE58241.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

EB5709BBE416472CB7521511B4F6645D.description: Adjust language choices according to purpose, task, and audience.

8C740001C3894AD38EEBC2932170229C.description:
Make predictions and inferences and draw conclusions from listening to a variety of texts,
performances, and multimedia sources.

A772872CE26C4D069DF17329B04D156D.description:
Express thoughts and opinions when discussing current events, concepts, themes, characters,
plot, and conflict resolution.

E2F7099232A547E3999A8964C1368242.description: Describe, explain, and evaluate text, self, and world experiences.

DA495291477640CAAE2AFF3893B9B3A4.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

EFFA7C7A28094DD49256AF0C194A71A3.description: Explain and defend opinions and subtle differences in viewpoints from peers, texts, and others.

DAC3B8AFB0584F7E86AAFC459BE12930.description:
Appropriately use an extended number of learned phrases and/or creative or original
responses.

3FE9D6C69DE74B949653F6D3D5F866E7.description:
Persuade others through debates and discussions using creative and/or original responses to express and defend
opinions or viewpoints.

8DA058FB03184FA6BC6A3BC047AF3F53.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions in speech.

7752B93032F949AEA5587027B14B7222.description:
Accurately and appropriately use a variety of grade-appropriate social, academic, and content-specific academic
words when giving speeches, presentations, and performances and when telling, retelling, explaining, and analyzing stories, personal experiences, and current/world events.

4B2049D2CF5E4A0A999D6041993111AA.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

172B7D316E544CFCB9B9A2509295CB7D.description: Listen to, discuss, evaluate, and respond to complex instructions and information.

899124D168244099824603035D6DAE87.description:
Think deeply/ponder/ruminate about closed- and open-ended questions and answer with increasing
sophistication.

98C85072F4484319A107BC178DE39A97.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

20684B32763348B0AB9532596AD70F9D.description:
Contribute to class, group, and partner discussions by taking turns; asking and answering relevant, on-topic questions; affirming others; providing additional, relevant information; paraphrasing and evaluating; and analyzing and synthesizing key ideas. Sustain conversations on a variety of appropriate and relevant academic
topics.

2CC0E5CF70394D028A34A47053E88DD9.description:
Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different
audiences.

BAAC1F356C9D4A58B64313009F581A60.description:
Listen to a variety of literature to distinguish or differentiate styles; analyze character
development, setting, tone, voice, and mood; and make connections to the text.

270E22C79EF642F2A5294F2F5B9F9FDA.description:
Listen to, respond to, react to, and analyze complex instructions and statements. Apply,
clarify, and provide instructions and directions.

A960CF64AF384F65A74C768AF80160A5.description:
Take turns and show consideration by concurring or affirming with others in discussions.
Extend ideas or arguments with support.

EACDD54400C949DB8CA17EB7B90AE63B.description:
Ask relevant questions that evoke elaboration. Respond to others’ questions and comments
with relevant observations and ideas that build the discussion and keep the conversation on topic.

5938E384FBCB4D589B35EA5B0D7603E0.description:
Listen, support discussions, and interact with peers during read-alouds (of fictional and informational texts); oral presentations/performances; and class, group, and partner discussions on a variety of grade-appropriate
academic and social topics.

1A751566E3FA4364A6A0B71BCB133103.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.
